task.title: Creating Profile Attributes
task.shortdesc: Learn how to create profile attributes (conditional text) in Oxygen XML Author

prereq.p: Ensure you have Oxygen XML Author v20 or later.

step.cmd: On the Preferences window search bar, enter Attributes.
From the expanded search result, select Attributes and Conditional Sets.
On the the Attributes and Conditional Sets section, select create.
Alternatively, select an existing one from the dropdown list and select Edit.
Enter the Document type, Attribute name, and Display name.
Select a value from the list (e.g., product 1, product 2, mobile, desktop, etc.)
Alternatively, you can create or edit a from the list by selecting New or Edit.
If you want to choose both value, select rdio button next to Multiple values seperated by: and select <space>, ",", or ";"
If you want to use pre-defined attributes (e.g., organisational level), select Import from DITA VAL and choose the file.
step.stepresult: This will import the attributes and you can choose either to Merge or Replace the selected attributes.

step.cmd: If you want to apply color to the attributes:

substep.cmd: On the Preferences window search bar, enter color.
From the expanded search result, select Colors and Styles.
On the Colors and Styles section, select New.
Alternatively, select an existing one from the dropdown list and select Edit or choose Automatic Styling.

step.stepresult: By following these steps, you can effectively create and manage profile attributes (conditional text) in Oxygen XML Author, allowing you to conditionally show or hide content based on specific attributes or conditions.

taskbody.postreq: After creating profile attributes, you can proceed to apply these attributes (conditional text) in Oxygen XML Author to control the visibility of content based on the defined conditions.
